review: I don't regret purchasing Chromecast because you can't beat the price, but I was expecting better quality from a Google product. I can get it to work after a little bit of playing around with the HDMI channels (sometimes upwards of 10 minutes of fiddling), however I expected it to be easy to use out of the package. I'm sure this is partially due to my older router, but that was the point of buying it, to work on a non-smart tv. Once it does work though, it's great, satisfied my House of Cards binge watching.

review: We had an off brand Roku-like-but-not setup on the kitchen TV.  While the CHROMECAST doesn't pull as many services (Amazon Instant, in  particular, is a glaring omission), for Netflix (my primary use), it is great.  Works without fail.  So cheap.
author: Charlie V

review: I purchased this item from Amazon based on the reviews.  This item was a total waste of money.  It never operated properly.  A new router was purchased and my internet service was upgraded.  I even downloaded the Chromecast software update.  The gadget always failed to be located.  It often would switch my HDMI to Chromecast in the middle of television shows that I was watching.  The chromecast would appear on visitors  smartphones as a wireless option uninvited.  A major concern for privacy to others.  The worst money ever spent.  I no longer trust Google and have uninstalled all of it's features from my computer.  I have even had a couple of my "computer geek" friends come to check out the problem.  All have agreed...it is a total piece of JUNK!  Buyer beware!!

review: Wouldn't a much more effective way to connect a computer to your TV be PLUGGING YOU COMPUTER INTO THE TV VIA HDMI?? Why the hell do we have to "Cast"or as I like to call it, stream wirelessly? Plug in the Computer to the TV via HDMI and you can "stream" all you want for about the cost of an HDMI cord. But you probably already have a few of those lying around.
